review_title: If you want work to become your life, Renown is for you!
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Reno, NV
pros: The pay is good and the patient population in Reno is very kind. The nurses I worked with are awesome! The travel nurses I worked with were also really good!
cons: I rarely was able to take a break. Most shifts I worked 13 hours straight without lunch and without a bathroom break. I have been a nurse for several years and never have I felt a job eat away at me like Renown. Severely understaffed for the acuity. The organization places all the blame on the nurse. During my orientation, the instructor of one of my mandatory classes stated, "I know Renown has a reputation for not supporting their nurses legally, but that's why we write policies." It is hard to follow their policies when you're severely understaffed with high acuity patients. If nurses forgot to chart something, the expectation was that I would have to come back into work within 24 hours or you would receive disciplinary action. MANY MANY requirements outside of your 3 scheduled shifts. I felt like I was working non-stop. Between my scheduled 3 shifts, on call shifts, meetings, eLearning, and mandatory class requirement, I felt like I never got a break. Vacation is almost never approved, and you can't cash out your PTO. I strongly recommend reconsidering working here, unless you are a traveler.

pros:
Renown is a really great company to work for. I have met very very few staff that I didn’t like. Everyone is very supportive of each other. Management is great and willing to work with schedules. Okay benefits. Self scheduling with smart square is awesome. EPIC emr is by far the best.
Great opportunity for growth. They offer a mentor program so you can orient other units before transferring.
cons:
Reno cost of living has sky rocketed to median home prices at 400-500k while renown wages remain the same as when homes cost 200-300k. It’s impossible to afford the cost of living. They justify low wages with “we provide great benefits at low cost”. The benefits are now a one price option that would factor out less than a dollar extra per hour if I opted out. Still not worth it. Meanwhile, travelers are hired in masses making TRIPLE+ what core staff make. We are also required to take on higher ratios than previously, float to COVID and other units, without any incentive. We are offered incentive IF we work overtime which is still not even close to the hourly that travelers make.
Also, parking is not good. Several break ins to vehicles have occurred. Uncovered parking which sucks in the winter.

review_title: Has potential to be even better!
pros:
1. A lot of locations within Nevada
2. Always new positions available
3. If you have the right leader you have opportunity to grow within Renown.
4. If you are a RN or physician you will excel within Renown
5. If you work during the day when they have promotions or recognition if they remember your department you get treats.
cons:
1. Does not recognize or celebrate the supportive roles within Renown. Renown focus with staff is based on RN and Physicians. The facilities, EVS, supportive roles are not supported well within the organization.
2. Leadership need a diversity course to help their understanding of their staff needs. Several of the supportive roles have staff that their 1st language is not English. Several do not have their own mode of transportation and small things like that is never taken into consideration. 
3. IT here is horrible. Everything breaks and tons or changes. 
4. The intranet resources they offer for staff are out of date , several of the links or information are broken, and the staff information is never updated in the directory. Very frustrating to get the information you need to do your job.
5. Leadership attend several meeting and any changes or information staff needs is never given to them from leadership. Communication can be improved on.
6. Leadership making changes or trying to improve a process need to include an actual staff who does the work daily on the committee to see the full impact of their decisions before its made.
7. Unless you are a RN or Physician Renown does not offer any training or educational classes for your role for growth.
8.  Having leaders come around with candy carts or food does not make up for lack of pay or change in your insurance costs.  By the time they come to your department half the staff is gone.

pros: Change in top leadership toward progressive transformation. Resources to do PR and public health positioning. Good intentions of the very top leadership. Motivated team of care providers (Drs, Nurses, Pt Contact teams). Well-intentioned and eager employees with positive attitudes capped by organizational management issues.
cons: Lack of vision, leadership, courage and willingness to take action by key leadership besides 1-2 key leaders. Many in positions of potential change prioritize personal job security over organizational leadership, because that is how they got to where they are. Opportunities are avoided because dodging risk results in making non-decisions, avoiding potential risk, not making waves and managing symptoms of the organization instead of having the vision to see the big picture, solve for the long-term and have the courage to take action to fix the problem versus the symptoms. The result is poor recruitment, retention, job satisfaction, lack of confidence in leadership and the "sinking ship" scenario. Confirming symptoms include continuing loss of physician network, reduction in utilization of facilities, inconsistent procedure flow, divergence among admin and staff, management teams pressured to prioritize the corporate line over honest communication, sense of staff not feeling involved until disinterested, staffing instabilities and a general sense that all is not well and being covered by the fluffy PR campaigns.

review_title: Not worth the money, drain of self worth, disappointment
pros: I love Renown values, the mission, and the vision of a just culture. If only you were allowed to follow these practices without repercussion it would be a great place to work.
cons: There are politics in every position. If you truly practice fairly and with the greater good of the patients as well as the staff in mind you are rejected. You  do not get the opportunity to continue to grow, as you are no longer a "good fit".  I have seen wonderful people worked out of their positions because they have their own minds and ideas that do not fit the carbon copy upper management expects you to be. Process improvements are encouraged but never implemented to their full potential due to departments leadership squandering over who will remain in power. Leadership is a step towards unemployment. Once deemed unfit you are blocked from any other position, you can try to transfer but it will do you no good. If you dare speak about what is being done to you you are let go. I have interviewed at 4 nearby hospitals and each has said the majority of their applicants are from Renown. Shockingly several of the applicants waiting for their interviews shared their experience with Renown and it was the same story as mine. Beware!

review_title: A place for people to do work
pros: You will meet some excellent people working for Renown but depending in which department you work in you may never get to know them as some departments are busier than others.  As everyone needs healthcare and the implementation of the Health Care Reform law took (and takes place), more work will be available in this field.
cons: Office culture is one in which you do not want to engage in.  There exist a lot of office politics and if you fall into a situation into which you are deemed a bad apple your chances for a transfer and or promotion will be hindered.  Being deemed a bad apple may not even be a grave issue in the sense that you are causing problems but if you express an opinion that is not satisfactory, contradicts, or calls into question decisions, methods, and, or, is not to the liking of your immediate supervisor(s) you will be seen as a bad employee.  At the location at which I worked management asked or suggestions but rarely took action to resolve ongoing issues.  In the long run this caused low morale and management feigned ignorance (or perhaps is was genuine) as to why this was the case.  It takes about a year in order for a new employee to understand that there is something rotten in Denmark.

pros: Flexibility, inspiration and latitude to do my best work. So happy and fortunate to have selected employment with Renown Health. Fighting the Good Fight is more than a tag line- it's the way the leadership works within a values culture to fight for the very best for employees, MDs, RNs, patients, families and the community every day. I am so happy here- supportive CEO who engages and communicates with everyone, great VP and director colleagues. A team who is passionate about bringing their best , learning new things and ways to excel, and dedicated and hard-working. The area is absolutely beautiful- warm and sunny every day and the towering pines of Lake Tahoe 30 minutes away. Take the job here, and you will be so glad you did. Renown and the CEO did an outstanding job communicating transparently and regularly through the COVID 19 pandemic, and is working hard not to have to lay off one employee of 7,000- despite being battered by the financial crisis. This is why I believe so highly in the leaders in this organization- they are committed to being the best.
cons: Rents and home prices in central Reno are climbing- it can be pricey to live here, because it is becoming so popular with CA and people from the bay area.

pros: My first month on the job has been great! The pay is competitive, the benefits are awesome, and the team is friendly and encouraging. Renown is the largest employer in northern Nevada and they are setting a positive precedent for other employers to follow. I am somewhat new to the Reno area and had a handful of really terrible interview experience before I found Renown Health. The difference between Renown Health and other local employers that I interviewed with was like night and day. The team at Renown was prompt, respectful, professional, and thorough throughout the recruitment and on-boarding process. Yes, it takes a while to get on board because there are several rounds of interviews followed by a drug test and physical, and then two days of orientation. However, I felt that this process was good because all employees are thoroughly vetted which leads to better retention. Everyone has heard horror stories about hospital administration, but I've been thoroughly impressed by the executives and leaders that I've worked with thus far, including Dr. Slonim. The leaders that I've worked with here at Renown put their employees and the Reno community first, which creates a safe and enjoyable work environment. I have a natural tendency to distrust authority, but here I feel supported by my supervisors. I would recommend Renown Health to anyone in Reno looking for a healthy workplace with great benefits.
cons: I haven't experienced any yet

review_title: To all patients and family members please forgive us and bear with us
job_title: Critical Care Technician in Reno, NV
pros: Employees who really do care about the patients
cons:
Employees who really care about you are used and abused.  Dear patients and patients family members I want to extend my deepest heartfelt apologies to any of you who may have been cared for a staff member that might have seemed a bit impatient, irritated or unfriendly.  Please forgive us, we really do care about you but the company we work for cares about making money,you are a number to them and so are we.  They want you in and out and to fill out a survey and pay your bill.  
The staff interact directly with you and care for you during you hospitalization are some great people who are given way too many patient then anyone person should ever care for, they work hard and go totally unappreciated.  They push themselves so hard to take on this crazy workload only to have the management tell them you don't do enough or your job is too easy for you.  We really care about our patients and go unrecognized by our nonpresent leadership that looks at the bottom line and the survey scores.  Renown is not a good company to work for, and if I ever express these opions to any leadership their mentality is If you don't like it then you know where the door is, they don't care.  ire them, burn them out, and replace them.

review_title: Avoid this toxic hospital at all costs
pros: Cannot think of one thing
cons: This is easily the worst hospital in the Reno area to work for.  A constant toxic work environment, I’m surprised I made it as long as I did!  Do yourself a favor and avoid this hospital at all costs!  The majority of renown’s nursing management does not want to be questioned.  What they say goes and if they decide they don’t like you, you will be a target.  Going to HR or the director of your floor will NOT help you.  Instead you will be retaliated against and made to feel like you cannot speak up. The managers will do absolutely anything to make you feel as if you have no one to help you.  They constantly berate you and speak negatively about you to your coworkers. They play favorites and encourage  bullying.  The management will make you feel as unwanted and unwelcome as possible.  They will harass you to try to break you down, if that doesn’t work they will lie to upper management to make you seem like you are the worst employee.  They will try anything possible in an attempt to put your nursing license at risk.  Don’t let them fool you.   Ask anyone who worked for Renown how they were treated, and what they have witnessed when they were an employee there.  The best day I had there was the day I quit!

pros: People give everything they have to the work they do, Ive met some truly amazing motivated intelligent hard workers
cons: I’ve worked for Renown for awhile now, and at first it was fun, educational, and fast paced. But then you start to realize how horribly run this place is. Management will replace you in a heartbeat, they don’t care about your well being, they demand more and more out of you while they push surveys and scores at you because their bonuses are affected by these. They get compensated the harder you work for them. Nurses are well understaffed on every floor, slammed with multiple patients which isn’t fair for them or the patients. It just isn’t safe. Ask any employee or traveler who’s come through here, Renown is one of the LOWEST paying hospitals and by far one of the busiest. If you try going to HR with any complaint or concern they immediately turn it on you and will defend management to no end. Again, you’re replaceable (though with the understaffing there they just don’t replace you at all and everyone is forced to work harder). Any accusation you bring up is met with hostility and they’ll look for any reason to write you up and get you out of there. Trust me i’ve seen it happen to multiple people. All in all this place just does not care whatsoever about their employees or patients for that matter. Everything is just numbers and dollars to them

I've grown a lot as a person within this position and I have always been treated fairly and with care and respect by the entire management team.  I feel very lucky. It is a large employer and, as such, has a wide variety of experiences of employees but mine is pretty much completely positive.

The benefit package is very good and is a big plus to working in a corporate environment.  There are tuition benefits (which I do not need) and many others such as volunteer time being paid. The soft benefits are  that are only getting better since I started here.  

I will say one last thing and that is that any good idea has a channel to be heard and that will only make Renown a more flexible and innovative organization moving forward.
cons: The cons are pretty standard fare. I feel the  starting pay for non-professional level personnel should be higher.  It is corporate so there can be the experience of  slowness with which most large organizations move when it comes to change.

review_title: If you want us to stay then you really need to seriously change somethings (RN)
pros: Nurses work hard and work together to care for patients
cons:
So many things wrong here I don't even know where to start.  Number one problem that we always have had and seem to continue with is bad management, it seems to be a pretty common theme throughout all of the review I've read about Renown.  Bad managers, bad HR that supports bad managers,  this is true and one of the main reasons they are having trouble retaining their best people.  It is becoming an entire hospital of new grad nurses and travelers, where is the stability. 

If they ever hope to make this a great place that can keep people then they should start listening to the ones who work here, and realize that bad management will ultimately destroy ever dept., and retrain HR because in my experience they have never supported employees, just side with the management, and really don't seem to care how many good people they lose.

Im not happy working here and I don't recommend this hospital to anyone, they have a long way to go, and progress seems very very slow, like they need to lose so many people to open their eyes.

review_title: A great place for great people to be unappreciated.
pros: Renown is a great place to gain experience if you are new in a career field.  The lower level managers are competent and care about their employees.  The insurance is decent (but could be better/cheaper considering they are RENOWN?!).
cons:
Upper management has unrealistic expectations of their underlings.  They are understaffed and expect their salaried employees to put in ridiculous hours for a company that does not care about them.  
Despite working in the medical field employees are encouraged to show up to work sick.  The policies regarding sick time basically guarantee this.
The pay scale is greatly skewed in  favour of upper management and there is zero room for negotiation.

review_title: Fantastic Work-Life Balance and Great Employees!
pros:
Renown Health is a great place to work because, simply stated, you get out what you put in. 
There is unlimited growth potential, including tuition reimbursement, organizational class offerings (including high-potential programs), education assistance, and career guidance. 
The compensation and benefits are competitive, with superior health insurance coverage at personalized levels to fit each employee/family's needs. Flex spending accounts, vision benefits, dental benefits, as well as other available ancillary benefits. A great recognition program and annual employee appreciation event, as well as employee discount offerings in the community. There is also an employee loan program, and financial wellness classes opportunities through our Healthy Tracks wellness program. Plenty of opportunities to volunteer and embrace our community, with 4 hours of paid volunteer hours per quarter (and other ways to help your chosen charitable organization). Great work/life balance with annual leave and wellness programs to get healthy and stay healthy, so you can live your best life. All of this and living in the great community of Reno/Sparks, and just a skip away from beautiful Lake Tahoe and other CA destinations. It's a great place to be!
cons: None that I have been made aware of in my role.

pros:
- This Company uses Hometown Health which offers 75% Coverage, 25% Co-Pay. (This is Extremely High)
- This Company offers Transfer Opportunities and continues to support your educational growth to better yourself. 
-  If you do not understand something within the company (i.e. benefits, coverage, time-off) they have someone always available to assist you.
cons:
- Coverage to their patients and customers. (Renown offers SO MANY services to their community. However, everyday I watch people turn themselves away from these services because certain departments are not set up to bill their insurance directly. Despite these departments best efforts to correspond with Contract Specialists, these side importance’s slip through the cracks. 
- Knee Jerk reactions if something comes up. (Renown’s response time in a crisis is phenomenal; however, a quick reaction could be just as bad as no reaction. Some plans around the hospital, I personally believe could  have been thought out better if they had just given themselves maybe a few more hours of weighing the odds.)

review_title: A COMPANY THAT SEEMS DEDICATED TO DESTROYING PEOPLE
pros: I don't want to fill out this part, what are the pros of working here?  I have an occupation, I guess?
cons:
Bad management, Too much work for one person to handle.  An HR employee who knows nothing about your work can judge you.  Those of us who are in the trenches everyday doing the crazy work and making this company exist get destroyed by the office workers who are clueless what it is like to be in our shoes day to day.
The managers are people from outside who sit at a desk and never experience our jobs, we work so hard for everything we have and then we can thrown away for something so small.  Everything you work hard for in this company can be lost for nothing, maybe you just offended or did not agree with your leader, they will find a way to get rid of you.  I see this game being played all around, backstabbing seems too be the culture here, it is a very cutthroat place.
People lose there livelihood, honest hardworking people, I feel so sad everyday I come to work and think this is a hospital, we are supposed to be here to care for people, yet such evil takes place here .

pros: Some people are great and there are some that make it a great team but that’s all! It’s hard to write 20 words of positive when there isn’t any!
cons: Horrible work environment and pay! No real benefits not worth your effort I once thought when I first started it was going to be good omg I was wrong! I worked for a real company real benefits and real pay in the past while living outside of Reno this is a huge joke and they really don’t care! It’s a revolving door for a reason! And HR will say we value our team blah blah will pass it on no they dont it bs! They need a union in all areas of jobs there hands down! Don’t do it! They could be the best being so big but instead they ARE the worst look at the reviews it’s all true!

review_title: Expendible-of little significance when compared to an overall purpose, and therefore able to be abandoned
job_title: Worked In OR in Reno, NV
pros: Made a few friends? That's about it
cons:
When you accept a position with this company you are going to work really hard and take pride in what you do everyday, you can earn a reputation amongst your peers as a good hard worker, you can be well liked by everyone you have taken care of working here, and really make a difference in there lives. 

 Then, due to the constant changes in leadership someone new will come along with a job title that ranks them higher than you, and this person with a higher job title can decide they don't like you, suddenly you realize all of the hard work, al of the sacrifice, all of the years of service mean nothing, you will learn just how insignificant you really are.

Employees of this company truly are expendibles, I have never witnessed such a fire happy HR department and bullies allowed to reign the way they do in this company.  It is not a good place to work, people are here today, gone tomorrow, no regard to the peoples lives and careers that are destroyed because of someones pride.

I resigned after 13 years, I've seen too much and it is sickening.

pros: Renown Hospital has the latest knowledge in the medical field and the best personal to help those people in need, my mother and father both were diagnosed with terminal cancer, and the treatment received from the medical team of Renown Hospital has made me want to become a part of this team and give the comfort to those people just like my parents received.
cons: When dealing with terminal people of many diseases, most go through stages of many different feelings, you as the caregiver have to realize that this person has the right to experience every feeling a person facing death does, most of the time you do come attached to these patients and it hurts each and every time that they are taken home to heaven. Then you know they are out of pain, and help the family come to realize this.

review_title: I cant keep up with the politics, Im too busy working hard
pros: If you can fit in with the in crowd you wont have to work very hard
cons:
The work environment inside food and nutrition really is pure toxic.
The managers are so rough and  unprofessional, some of them have hired their personal friends from outside and these people have it made, they dont have ro work so hard and their jobs are never threatened like the rest of us.
The managers and their friends have formed a closed group in the department, you have to try to fit in with this group or your work environment will be very unpleasant. People such as myself who dont fit in with this in crowd are made outcasts and are treated spitefully, its kind of like being in high school again.

The  work is very hard and stressful, the department is very messed up and the leadership is horrible, even if you give this hard job 100% everyday it will not matter, its all about being friends with the cool people.  This type of pressure to fit in on top of the stress from the crazy work makes the kitchen an unbearable place to work.

review_title: My career at Renown Health in Reno NV
job_title: Supply Chain Manager in Reno, NV
pros:
Renown is amazing as they allow you to learn and grow in your roles.  We are very big on promoting from within along with recognizing exception talent from the outside.  
I came to work at Renown in the Receiving Department and was running that Department with 3 months.  After almost 2 years, I moved to the Purchasing Department and have been promoted 5 times in the last 10 years.  
I completed my Bachelor's Degree and will be beginning my Masters in the fall all with the help of Renown's Tuition reimbursement program.
cons: I am happy to report that like any large corporation, communication was an issue but Renown has put a lot of effort and technology into the communication ability and training.

review_title: Renown needs to be better and they know it. Things wont change though.
pros:
My coworkers are amazing and consistently have kept me from crying in the supply closet because I was the only tech on the entire unit, again. 
They're always hiring because they can't keep people.
cons:
Don't expect respect from management unless you work in management or are an MD, NP, PA, etc.
Expectations will pile up one after the other, they will not give you the staff to get it done though. It still has to be done though.

job_title: Mid-level Human Resources in Reno, NV
pros: Nice campus and numerous facilities.
cons: Actual treatment of employees does not support Renown's stated vision, mission, and especially values. Many senior managers achieve their positions without any prior management experience or education, which negatively affects their subordinates' performance and job satisfaction. Many mid-to-upper level management hires are made without applicants meeting the minimum requirements for their jobs. Executives look out for each others' career advancement rather than focusing on patient care, problem solving, and employee retention; Toxic management culture exists in Operations, HR, Finance, Admin, Nursing.  Bullying runs rampant in the HR and Finance Departments due to poor executive oversight and metrics, and permeates the organization like a disease.

job_title: Surgery OR Assistant in Reno, NV
pros: Experience, that is hands-down the only good thing about it
cons:
First, you were going to work very hard for very little pay, even though the surgery department makes the most money for the entire network.
Second, It is an abusive environment very abrasive people.
Third, turnover is extremely high this is nothing more than a revolving door, management as well as upper management seems to see no problem with this nor do they seem to care about retaining quality employees. 
Fourth, no effort is being put forth to make this is a better place to work, as an employee you are seen as an expendable resource, they would be happy to replace you with someone for less money although In the end our patients are the ones who suffer due to the lack of experience to skilled staff, truly valuable employees that make valuable contributions are eventually runoff by poor leadership.
In conclusion, there was really no incentive for anyone to stay.

pros: Renown Health has a health ecosystem that few other systems have.  Its vertically integrated with an ACO, Health Insurance Company, multiple hospitals and clinics, labs and other services.  This means that our ability to take care of a patient is beyond that of an organization that only interacts with patients at one point or another.  This positioning, coupled with the professionalism of leadership and human resources, makes working for Renown Health bigger than just a job.  We are a team focused on patient/family/community health with the power to actually move the needle.
cons: Because Renown Health focuses on care across the continuum, everything has to be coordinated.  From Ambulatory to Acute Care to Home Health, the patient has to have the same experience to ensure their success.  This takes time and energy, but totally worth it.

review_title: Politics more important than patient care
pros: The second floor shops came in handy especially with the ability to charge the purchases
cons: "It's not what you know; it's who you know." That can be helpful if you are looking for a job; but if you are attempting to hold on to the one you've got and someone would like to put a feather in their harassment cap it can be a horrible place to work.  The leadership that existed in 2012 encouraged bullying techniques including abusive behavior.  HR in particular aligned with their favorite leaders and allowed intolerable behavior to take place during job reviews.  The politics in general allowed things to occur like making the gardens off limits to employees even though it was the employees contributions that brought these gardens into existence.

pros: Renown offers flexible schedules and is in an amazing location for the outdoor enthusiast. I have had great co-workers in all the areas I have worked. Reno is an interesting place and you'll therefore have interesting clients. The pace is varied and depends on the time of year. Though there are some repetitive aspects to the work it is generally fresh and there's always something new to learn.
cons: Management can be less than supportive in many instances and grievances can be touchy to file as  one might be accused of lying. We definitely don't have the supplies we need at our fingertips sometimes and other departments are generally as short-staffed as you are thus creating a lot of waiting.

pros: I enjoy working for an organization who has a clear mission and keeps that mission at the center of focus each and every day; whether your role is direct or indirect patient care, you understand the impact you have on the overall health and well-being of our community.  I look forward to coming in each day because of the work I am able to do and the people I work with.
cons: There is a misconception about living in Reno, which at times makes it difficult to attract top talent to the area. However, in a recent publication of Outside Magazine, Reno was listed as one of the best 25 towns in the nation! We are a very diverse community and people from all over the country are starting to understand what a great town we get to call home.

review_title: what was once a great company to work for now brought down by bad management
pros: The mission of the company seems to be genuine
cons:
The title should be pretty self explanatory.  This really was once a place people wanted to be, it used to be hard getting in because people would never leave their jobs, they were happy..
Those days seem to be a mere memory now.  Turnover is huge,  constant changes and careless managers who push people beyond what id reasonable, we've been told many times thats the way it is and that Renown is just a hard place to work, not much of a moral booster.  I dont see much hope foe the future of this ever being a good job again.  That coupled alongside the bullying and politics that take place at work make it a truly undesirable place to remain

pros: Great people to work with. If you transfer departments and don't like it, you can go back to your old department. 12 hour shifts are long but nice to have. We help the whole community. We are expanding our areas of care and expertise.  Insurance is good but expensive. The daycare is one of the most expensive in town and they are not suited to the employees hours and aren't even open on weekends.
cons: Although pay adjustments have been made, Alot of employees need 2nd jobs to be able to make a living. A few employees have left to other less desirable jobs that pay more. If you get written up you have to wait a year to transfer to another department. He dosent listen to employees complaints about managers/supervisor.

pros: They have personally developed me through leadership classes, speech classes, shadow opportunities, and leadership opportunities.  The care, compassion, and excellence is what sets this experience apart from all others. The leaders I have worked with want to see growth in others. This has been my best job (I've been in the industry 20 years).
cons: This job has been nothing short of amazing! I have no bad experiences.

review_title: Bad leadership, no direction, hostile environment
pros: A paycheck, thats about it
cons:
I worked as a cashier in the cafeteria less than a year, myself as well as quite a few others resigned because we found that environment intolerable.  

The poor management is reflected through the lack of morale you see in the employees.  Bullying is a regular occurance in that department that goes unchecked and constantly gets worse.  Those doing the bullying drive away alot of new comers because they are aloud to continue in their ways.  The manager is not involved enough to recognize those employees bringing the department down.

HR does not seem to care. Im just happy I left that place, I would not recommend this job to anyone, the department is totally unorganized and chaotic.  Management is unqualified, and co-workers dont seem to really get along.  I am so much happier now that I am no longer a part of that mess.

review_title: Don't put in your two weeks!
pros: The therapy department was excellent to work with.
cons: I had hurt my back four times in less than a year. While on light duty for the most significant injury, I decided to change employment for my personal safety. A day after putting in my two weeks notice, I was asked to leave. HR treated me with such disrespect and lack of human decency, it ruined my perception of Renown Health as a whole. I was escorted to my car and was not permitted to say goodbye to the coworkers who had become my friends. While being told to leave the premise, she stalked behind me and asked my manager to follow us “for another set of eyes”. She made me feel like I was being fired, when in fact I was the one who resigned. A company that would stoop so low to save less than two weeks pay for an employee, who had been hurt on their watch, is not a company I could ever encourage others to work under.

pros: The patient population is very diverse, they say working one year equals 7 dog years because of how quickly you learn so many skills. Match 3% 401k, will provide classes for BLS renewal, ACLS renewal and TNCC. Doctors are very nice and willing to teach. Co works are hard working and intelligent. Able to pick up overtime. Will hire/train new grads
cons: There is mandatory once month on-call shift for RN. Sometimes it’s hard to get vacation approved. No patient ratios, as a CNA I could have on my worse night 18 patients, on Med/Surg/Tele as RN on my worst night had 7 patients, in the ER as RN on my worst night had 5 patients, as ICU RN worst night could have 3 patients.

pros: Working for Renown specifically the lab has been nothing short of great.  The leadership in the lab are constantly encouraging growth with in the department.  My leader has provided leadership training, and mentoring to help me progress and advance.  The knowledge I have gained through Renown University and the knowledge passed on to me from my leader are unmatched by anything I could have expected.  Leadership stresses patient satisfaction, but in a way that promotes a tight team dynamic.  This is appreciated by myself and also my coworkers.  To know that the leaders have your back and encourage professional growth is amazing.
cons: There are no cons working here.

pros: I care about my patients
cons:
Understaffed, unsafe for patients, I would not want to be a patient in this hospital. 
Many people suffer due to corporate greed, this company values making money over ensuring the day to day operations can function.
Way too much is expected of one person, and quality care is impossible to provide when you are exhausted to the point that you dread going to work everyday.  I literally wake up each day and feel drained just thinking of what I have to face each shift.  I go home completely spent with no energy for anything else.  All if this crazy hard work is not appreciated, I feel used and abused.
We are judged by survey scores no matter how hard we work, it feels like we just keep going further downhill, hopeless, I dont want to be a part if this mess anymore.

review_title: Great company foundation, but management issues
pros: Transitioning to transformational health care philosophy; pay, benefits and employee rewards system are excellent; large enough for growth opportunities
cons: Job description did not reflect actual duties; manager wasn't truly managing and staff was taking advantage of that; excessive meetings. Management is changing so hopefully some of the cultural issues will as well.

pros: I started working at Renown in the beginning of 2020 and it has been a great experience so far. The onboarding experience was excellent and the entire interview and hiring process was transparent. I have already grown a lot as a professional during my time here, and feel so valued by my leaders. Renown has excellent benefits and resources for staff, along with an established culture of caring for each other. We are encouraged to find a work/life balance from day one at the organization.
cons: I can't think of any negative aspects about working at Renown. Before starting, I was concerned about working for such a large organization and not having a voice. But that is not the case, I truly feel taken care of, heard and seen by senior leadership.

review_title: Wow! Culture and Benefits at Renown Health are Amazing
pros: Having worked on the East Coast in healthcare for many years, I am now so pleased to be at Renown. The leadership and CEO is world-class, and the culture of "courtesy and respect" is impressive. As the market leader in this area, the organization continues to grow and make investments in the health- as well as the health care of the people who live in the most beautiful place on earth. It's sunny every day here in Reno- and the people are even "sunnier" than the weather. The benefits are the richest I've ever encountered in healthcare, and the work/life balance is talked about- and achieved!
cons: Need to recruit additional MDs mean some specialties are in high demand, and you may encounter a wait.

job_title: Respiratory Care Practitioner I in Reno, NV
pros:
1. Lots of yummy purple Kool-Aid
2. Badge Pay
3. Employment there is comparable to being plunged into a fiery furnace...if you escape, you know without a shadow of a doubt that you are made like unto the most durable of metals; your edge will have been molded to be all the more keener, having survived it's wrath.
cons: Do not imbibe the seductive purple kool aid, lest ye surely perish. Hearken to the voices which precede ye, oh weary job seeker! Lose not your soul to this abominable harlot, nor partake of her cup of wrath. For therein lies damnation, with weeping and gnashing of teeth. All the hosts of Hades surround+ trembling in awe at the brazeness of this beast, as they cry out that corruption is the business of this place.

pros: Many of us young people can work here part time while going to school
cons: This is in no way a job I would ever recomend doing long term.  Trayline is a nightmare everyday, the entire kitchen as a whole is unorganized, dirty, and chaotic everyday.  The management really seems to just be winging it from day to day, and shows no real leadership qualities, they are usually in a bad mood and are not easy to talk to.  The turnover is really high with mist just staying only a few months, the work is crazy we are driven like slaves, they put a phrase on the board in the cook part of the kitchen saying "work harder than the person next to you" really thats my motivation?  The pay is not that great and we can easily find another job with a comparable salary that wont mistreat us.

review_title: 'Hierarchy with some good apples and some bad ones'
pros: Get to met new people every day, Some staff is nice, Feel like you're making a positive impact and being paid decent money for it compared to other entry level jobs, management works with your schedule immensely and are usually supportive. possibility of moving up the chain
cons: Management usually aren't former transporters, lack complete understanding of what the job is like, many 'HIPAA regulations' don't make sense such as not taking patients through certain areas, some rules are introduced with no backing and make no sense, 'mandatory overtime', doesn't seem supportive of some opinions, lots of stuff left unexplained

review_title: Renown is a terrible organization as a whole
job_title: Critical Care Technician in Reno, NV
pros: Always work to be done. Coworkers are great. Overtime . That's about it, suggest you spent little time hear as core staff
cons:
Low pay for middle workers, benefits are trash if you're already not getting paid much which affects all auxiliary work processes and main workflows. If you're single (no family) Say good bye to your weekends and holidays with little negotiating. I honestly think this place is a for profit organization that prides itself on paying its workers nothing so that the directors can pocket 6 figures. 

If you're a nurse just become a travel Nurse. Core staff gets miss treated and the organization has to hash out millions to pay for traveler nurses due to the fact that they can't keep core staff it is hilarious. 

Will definitely be leaving soon just like all other core staff

review_title: The best place I have worked!
pros: I have worked both at South Meadows and Regional- I have enjoyed working at both places and find the attitude and atmosphere of Renown so pleasant and interesting. I don't think I have come across anyone unpleasant in any department I have had contact with-from the day I was interviewed in 2008 to today. I love working here and look forward to going to work each day!
cons: We have so many departments and services, I sometimes don't know everything Renown has to offer-I would like to be more aware of all the services Renown offers so I can make more referrals to these departments.

pros: Some coworkers are hard working and there is a sense of comrade in the misery and mistreatment.
cons:
HR decisions based on managements account only,  lack of policy enforcement or clarity. Leader positions hired from outside the i\institution are not well respected for bringing in new ideas or suggestions.  Very little in the respect of employee engagement and succession planning.  Leadership positions are a revolving door leading to a lack of talent and self-centered harassment tactics for treating employees.   A medical center this size should not have this amount of leadership positions constantly posted.  This is a sinking ship, do not climb aboard.  Lots of employee terminations.
Less than average pay for area.

job_title: Service Excellence Representative in Reno, NV
pros: To have patients coming to us, not really knowing what to expect, and leaving here with a new outlook. I enjoy the smile on their faces when I wear my crazy socks and my butterflies and they can't wait to see what is coming for the next day. they call me the crazy sock lady even when I call on my 30 day out if they can't remember my name. I love my coworkers when they have a trying patient and ask for a little guidance. Everyone here is family.
cons: My patients leave and some I don't hear from again.

pros: Student loan repayment program and tuition reimbursement available on day one, paid military leave, a wellness program that makes a difference, low employee premiums for health care (even a free plan), generous 401(k) match . What more could you want! When you combine these amazing benefits with an inspiring Mission and Vision, amazing career and development opportunities, flexible and engaging work environment, and remarkable team members with diverse backgrounds, your CAREER Rewards at Renown are invaluable.
cons: If you like an exciting work environment with a fast pace and many opportunities to learn and grow, this is the place for you! It's an exciting time to be in health care!

pros: I work with an amazing team! The team is extremely supportive and genuinely cares about the quality of care we provide! Personally, I am very appreciative for the flexibility I have been given with my schedule. Renown has worked with me to the best of their ability to help provide me a schedule that works for my family, therefore creating a much better work-life balance for me. Renown is a great place to work and the organization offers their employees multiple avenues to help them achieve their personal goals.
cons: I do not personally have any cons from my time with Renown.  No matter where you are employed, every organization will have it's unique challenges and areas for opportunity. I am proud to be apart of the Renown Team!

review_title: Great new grad experience. Low pay. High politics
pros: Amazing experience in every department as far as trauma, critical care, ER, postpartum, specialties
cons: Although it’s the largest hospital where you gain the most experience and work the hardest....it’s the lowest paying hospital in the Northern Nevada area. Too many politics. So many travelers due to high turn over.  Upper management treats you like your disposable. Would rather higher another new grad right behind you that they can pay less than have experienced nurses.

job_title: Clinical Lab Assistant in Reno, NV
pros: Abused employees form bonds to help eachother make it through each painful shift
cons: Unrealistic workload, totally unappreciated, ingnorant abusive management.  This is no place to make a career, if you still decide to work here just doot to make money while you look for another job, do not make any investments or buy anything new, that will not be wise being that we work in a very unstable environment and can be termiated easily if we upset our leadership.  HR will always back the managers no matter who is in the wrong, I feel de-humanized by this company, and regret joining, I would advise against excepting employment with Renown.  They will make it sound like an awesome company to work for, but once your in you will see just how rotten to the core this company really is.

pros: pay is good for now..
cons:
I'm a new employee at la. And I hate that there's no help for new people since we're so short staffed. 

Morning run is so way too much work for a couple of people and since pretty much everyone is running around.  There's no one to help me if I need it or to train on different ways to do my job correctly and sufficiently. I was told that there was one girl from lab that worked graveyard that used to train new people but she quit ugh i wonder why!!!! I'm actively looking for another job as this job sucks and management is not helping as they ignore my request for help.

review_title: I cant think of anything I'd rather do less than come to work everyday at this disgusting crooked corrupted company
pros: My days off are all I can think postively about
cons:
Where do I start.  My time at Renown has been overwhelmingly stressful mostly due to terrible leaders who expect you to work all day with no real break while they lean back in a comfortable chair in the office relaxing.  I often have to hold my urine for hours at a time because of the relentless workload and all the people I'm expected to care for with no help.
It is disgusting that we take on such a heavy workload just to save this company a few dollars and make the executives rich.
Dont buy into the marketing that wants you to believe this is a workers paradise .  This company will destroy and replace you like a tool.

review_title: A Great Place For People To Do Great Work - Everyday
pros: Renown Health gives you the opportunity to expand your career growth by offering courses within the organization to learn about yourself and what your role is in the success the organization. The established "just culture" at Renown has helped everyone in the organization have a voice and hold themselves and their peers or even leadership teams accountable, because of just culture there is a sense of open communication throughout the organization and more people are willing to stop the line and speak up. No matter what your role is Renown gives you tools and the opportunity to know that you are making a difference.
cons: communication of changes between divisions of Renown Health lacks

review_title: Unorganized, chaotic, complete mess...sound like a good place to work?
pros: Nice looking buildin, lots of artwork
cons: Where do I start, this company is a complete mess created by leadership with huge egos and very little ability.  Sad,  I think ghe CEO may be genuine in his desire to turn Renown into a good company but he had no idea what a mess he was walking into.  Myself as well as many other RNs are actively seeking employment elsewhere, tired of working so hard just to be treated like trash by inexperienced leadership of all levels.  Survey scores meanmore to this company than people who work hard everday.  Do like everyone else get your exoerience here and move on, this is no place to make a career.

review_title: Renown truly is a place for great people to do great work
job_title: Respiratory Care Practitioner in Reno, NV
pros:
Amazing department management who truly care about your success and really listen to you.

Write your own schedule (for the most part)

Exceptional coworkers who are always willing and able to help each other out

Protocols based on Best Practices provide a high level of professional autonomy

review_title: Poor HR department, low pay, high work loads
pros:
Good place to get initial experience in the medical field.
Broad experience opportunities.
Easy to pick up up extra shifts.
cons:
Pay - while base salaries are comparable their shift differentials are less than every other hospital in the area.

Work load - I've worked in the lab and as a nurse at Renown. In the lab, the phlebotomists average about 3 times the number of draws as any other hospital in the area on their highest volume days and all areas are usually under-staffed. As a nurse they'll tell you that you'll average 4 patients at a time like most hospitals in the area, but 6 and 7 patients is very, very common. They're notorious for burning out their nurses.

HR department is horrible - They're slow to set up initial interviews (probably under-staffed) then they seem to get involved in nit-picky "rule violations" that are applied selectively. I avoided them for the most part, but I witnessed the HR department target other employees. And it wasn't even employees that managers were having issues with (as some HRs will act as a shield for management). They seem to target employees on their own. 

Benefits - On the surface the benefits seem good and are comparable to the area, but there are some troubling anomalies. You lose earned vacation when you leave. Every other employer I've worked for paid you for vacation days you earned but didn't use upon leaving, but Renown doesn't. I'm not even sure how that's legal. They also used pay you for your unused sick time, basically as an incentive to show up, but that was taken away as well. Now the incentive is to call in sick every couple of months.

pros: The best reason to work for Renown is their policy of inclusion, collaboration, compassion and caring. These charecteristics are not only goals towards better patient care, they are the mentality of the people. I moved from Las Vegas to work in Reno, I had done a clinical rotation as a therapist 18 years earlier at what was then Washoe Medical center. From the moment I was hired I've been happy with the inclusive nature of my Director Kendra Webber, and the Staff of the Rehab department as well, When working with patients on the floor in the past one of the biggest challenges has been collaboration and assistance from the nursing/CNA staff. But here the attitude of teamwork and collaboration is truly at work making for what is ultimately a great experience for our customers. Lastly, some say "your pay rate are not competitive", I say , look at the numbers outside of salaries, When I added up all the generous benefits provided by the corporation, I'm actually making more that I have in previous years. Just the reduced cost of Medical insurance is a substantial consideration. In closing, Every one I meet that's a new employees or potential one I say" Renown is a great place to work, because of the compassionate corporate culture that is in place. I truly look forward to a long and satisfying relationship with this company and its customers and  the great opportunities to grow as a person, and a therapist.
cons: The downside of working for Renown is not the company, Its the challenges of dealing with people who don't respect the staff, Im not sure if its a cultural thing or what, but entitlement seems rampant in a certain segment of our customer base, and that makes for a challenging delivery of services at times.

pros: A place to work and get a check
cons:
I read all the reviews for Renown on this site and noticed how someone from the company is replying to them apologizing and encouraging people who still work there to use their open door policy to express any concerns.

While I was still employed I was one of those people who were stupid enough to utilize that open door policy and make a complaint to our HR business partner about the way our manager was mistreating me.  I was stupid enough to beleive that I actually work for a company that really cares about its people and would never tolerate someone in a management position treating so many employees the way ours did.  Our manager was harsh, did not care how offensive she was when she spoke to us, she made us feel worthless, and she would constantly gossip about other employees, just a hateful person.  Anyway, after I had enough of this poor treatment while working so hard everday, I utilized Renowns open door policy to go talk about the way myself as well as my co workers were being treated.  I was confident that something was going change from this.  The result was a meeting in HR with me, my boss, and her boss.  I was told by the HR business partner "so Im guessing you dont want to do your job anymore" and "you have given us the impression that you just want to cause trouble for everyone in your department instead of just coming in and doing your job"  It was just a time for my manager and HR to sit me down and rip me apart.  By the end of the meeting I was told that I am lucky to still have a job, and went back to work demoralized beyond repair.  Thank you St Marys for hiring me so I could leave that hell.

review_title: I chose my life over Renown
job_title: Clinical Lab Assistant in Reno, NV
pros: nothing I can think of, it was a bad experience from the beginning to the end that only got worse with time
cons:
This overwhelmingly stressful work environment caused my health to decline overtime, I had to leave, there was no other way.  Both my MD and my Psychologist told me the only way I would ever recover would be to leave my hostile negative work environment. 
The things this company put me through really took a toll on me after a couple of years.  No one can remain in a state of high adrenaline and stress all day every single day, the human body is not built to endure it nonstop.  This is what Renown did to me everyday.  The workload is way higher than any other hospital, and I know because I worked at two different hospitals before Renown, way too much work is given to one person, and don't you dare ever say that it its too much, no, don't you dare be honest and straight forward with the management.  This is where the pyscological abuse comes into play.  I was considered a bigtime trouble maker because I dared to speak up and say something about our work conditions, I wanted to make suggestions and see if our entire team could work together somehow just to make our daily tasks more tolerable.  OH NO!  this was a huge mistake, I became a target, and the management manipulated my co-workers into treating me like I had the plague, everyone avoided me.  All of this combined, too much work and mental stress finally gave me hypertension and anxiety, thankfully I can report that since leaving the company my health is improving, and I have gained my quality of life again. 
I hope more people are brave enough to reclaim there lives if the abuse will not stop.  In the end you will be thankful that you did, believe me I am a witness.

review_title: No amount of money will ever bring me back to working at this hospital.

pros: Passionate co workers who give everything to assure patients are taken care of.
cons:
When you are first hired you are inundated with how wonderful Renown is and you feel optimistic but the reality of working for this company is much darker.

Everywhere I worked we were short staffed. In the back of my mind red flags were going off but it couldn't really be that bad could it?

I was repeatedly put into workdays that were 13 hours or more with no breaks and no lunches. There was no time we were too overwhelmed we could barely use the restroom if we were lucky. When I first addressed this to management they stated "That is just how it is."
There is no work life balance I barely saw my family.
When I finally got firm about these Nevada Labor Law violations is when they started to panic and scramble to get me to human resources.

I could see that this is indeed "Just the way it is" and resigned.
If you are being hired as a Medical Assistant be aware that the amount of work you will be required to do is absolutely insane for the very low pay they give you.

Be aware that Physicians, Physician Assistants and Nurse Practitioners are provided an appropriate salary for the long hours they endure but as a Medical Assistant they will absolutely bleed your soul dry without a second thought.

I was also and exempt employee so I didn't qualify for overtime but my supervisor stated she had no problem working me into overtime. Excuse me?

Google Renown and Sierra Nevada Cardiology Associates lawsuit to read about the horrible way the physicians were treated. The CEO had to resign. But the bad company culture is still there.
